citation.article-title: Paenibacillus siamensis sp. nov., Paenibacillus septentrionalis sp. nov. and Paenibacillus montaniterrae sp. nov., xylanase-producing bacteria from Thai soils.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Paenibacillus septentrionalis sp. nov.
Paenibacillus septentrionalis (sep.ten′tri.o.na′lis. L. masc. adj. septentrionalis northern, referring to the isolation of the type strain from the northern province, Nan, Thailand).
Central or subterminal ellipsoidal endospores are observed in swollen sporangia.
Grows at pH 7–9, at 15–45 °C, in 3 and 5 % NaCl and under anaerobic conditions; does not grow at pH 5–6, 10 °C or 50–60 °C.

Positive for catalase, the Voges–Proskauer reaction, urease and hydrolysis of aesculin, starch and Tween 80; negative for oxidase, the methyl red test, DNase, indole production, growth on Simmons' citrate and TSI agar, nitrate reduction, dihydroxyacetone production and hydrolysis of l-arginine, casein, gelatin and l-tyrosine.
Acid production from aesculin, d-glucose, glycogen and starch.

No acid production from adonitol, amygdalin, d- or l-arabinose, d- or l-arabitol, arbutin, cellobiose, dulcitol, erythritol, d-fructose, d- or l-fucose, d-galactose, gentiobiose, gluconate, 2- or 5-ketogluconate, glycerol, methyl α-d-glucoside, N-acetylglucosamine, inositol, inulin, d-lactose, maltose, d-mannose, methyl α-d-mannoside, d-mannitol, melezitose, melibiose, raffinose, l-rhamnose, d-ribose, d- or l-xylose, methyl β-d-xyloside, salicin, l-sorbose, d-sorbitol, sucrose, trehalose, xylitol, turanose, d-lyxose or d-tagatose.
The cell-wall diamino acid is meso-DAP.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 47.3 mol%.
The predominant cellular fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0 and C16 : 0.
